sub_title: Product UX Designer 💖  Passionate about designing inclusive products and services that have a positive impact.
summary:
I’m a User Experience and Product Designer with a background in advertising photography. I bring an entrepreneurial attitude, a detailed eye, and endless curiosity to the team. Fueled by creativity and excited by challenges, I'm passionate about designing inclusive products that have a positive impact! I want to be at the heart of a user’s product experience.

My colleagues have complimented me for being thoughtful, analytical, creative, dedicated, and passionate.

education.field_of_study: User Experience Design Immersive, UX Design

profile_positions.description:
I work with a variety of clients to guide and improve their user experiences and define new products through market analysis, user research, content audits, flows, wireframing, user testing, and prototyping. I really enjoy the end-to-end process, especially ideating and designing ways to solve user needs. 

• Market & feature analysis
• User research
• Develop problem statements
• Visualize findings through empathy maps and personas
• Create customer journey maps to highlight key areas of opportunity
• Present key findings to stakeholders
• Facilitate ideation sessions with stakeholders
• Create user flows and map out content through site/app maps
• Create wireframes and clickable prototypes
profile_positions.title: UX & Product Designer

profile_positions.description: In a 12 week full-time course taught by industry professionals, I completed 5 concept projects and 1 client project. During the course, I learned the end-to-end UX design process and the foundations of UI design. Working in both teams and individually, I used design thinking and implemented lean/agile methodologies such as project canvas, daily stand-ups, team Kanban board and project retrospectives.
profile_positions.title: UX Designer

profile_positions.description:
2-Week Sprint • Client Project • Team of 4 • Website
PitchMe is an anonymous skill-based recruitment platform that helps to match people to their dream jobs while simultaneously speeding up the hiring process for companies.  

We refined and designed an MVP for our client after extensive research, with the ultimate business goal of increasing the profile completion rate by two-fold. We did this by focusing on building user trust while simplifying the onboarding journey and re-designing the user profile page. I was involved in every part of the design process, with a strong emphasis on research and mid-fi to hi-fi wireframing. The client felt inspired by our design process and was excited to see their product through fresh eyes.
profile_positions.title: PitchMe - Streamlining the onboarding process and building user trust

profile_positions.description:
2-Week Sprint • Product Concept • Team of 4 • Website
We designed a web-based event browser and platform for TimeOut London that allows users to find and attend online events with friends. I conducted competitive analysis, user research, and testing through each iteration of the design. I was heavily involved in general user research, defining the problem, and user testing. My teammate, James, and I designed and iterated the entire live-stream platform from mid-fi to hi-fi.
profile_positions.title: TimeStream x TimeOut - Connecting with friends at remote events

profile_positions.description:
1 Week Sprint • Product Concept • Individual • Adaptive Design for 3 viewports
I re-branded and reskinned an existing non-profit’s homepage to help clearly communicate their message, build trust, and increase donations. Deliverables included an adaptive hi-fi homepage for 3 viewports and a style guide. I carried out a hierarchical evaluation of the existing site content and used sketching and mind-mapping exercises to help explore the key values of the non-profit. Creating a mood board helped to guide my visual design choices.
profile_positions.title: Camp del Corazon - Re-skinning & Adaptive homepage design

profile_positions.description:
1 Week Sprint • Product Concept • Individual • App
I created a subscription-based knitting app that offers a variety of knitting projects at various levels. Given full creative freedom to define the brand, I chose to focus on a more niche area by offering high-end knitting patterns (effectively filling a gap in the market).  Creating brand values and limitations helped to inform the aesthetics and develop a visual identity.
profile_positions.title: Form - Subscription-based knitting app

profile_positions.description:
2-Week Sprint • Product Concept • Team Research & Individual Design • Website
I designed an e-commerce website for a local art store in London. I conducted competitive analysis, user interviews, and card sorts alongside my teammates. I then individually designed and delivered a mid-fi prototype of the site including the homepage, product listing page, product detail page, and checkout flow.
profile_positions.title: Craft & Co - E-commerce website

profile_positions.description:
1 Week Sprint • Concept Project • Individual • App
I identified a common problem in a fellow student’s life through user interviews and designed an app to solve it. I created low-fidelity screens to demonstrate how it would function. I carried out user research, wireframing, and rapid prototyping.
profile_positions.title: Smart Returns - Taking the hassle out of online shopping

profile_positions.description:
Together with Chad, I conceptualized, produced, and executed professional photoshoots within the fashion and advertising industries.   

Understanding the client’s needs, fulfilling high-volume image quotas (to spec), and meeting quick deadlines were paramount to our success. Every photoshoot consisted of extensive pre-planning, on-the-spot problem solving, and collaborating with the creative team. 

Notable Projects:

• Vogue (NYC) –We successfully produced 5 different shoots in 2 weeks in New York City. Most notably, was the series we did for Vogue Magazine. The pre-production and research involved to make each of these shoots happen was extensive, but paid off in the end! 

• Cape Town, South Africa – 4 different shoots in 10 days. We researched and contacted individuals to photograph who are making a difference in their community. Notably was Bonga.org Cycling Academy (Changing lives through sport and education). We landed a special feature in Athleta and Goodsport Magazine that helped bring attention to Bonga's inspirational youth program.  

• Calvin Klein & Tommy Hilfiger – Fast-paced e-commerce environment. We worked closely with art and creative directors, maintaining a consistent feeling in the imagery of the brand across all platforms. We developed a smooth workflow and teamwork was essential in order to complete the target number of looks each day.

• Levi’s x Vogue – We worked closely with the creative director of Vogue to photograph an
advertorial campaign for Levi’s to be used in Vogue and Vogue Man.
profile_positions.title: Co-Owner • Photographer

profile_positions.description:
I worked on global advertising campaigns with industry-leading photographers, art and creative directors, and clientele in a fast-paced environment.    

Working alongside the creative team, some of my responsibilities included: on-the-spot technical troubleshooting, ensuring file specs were met, and developing custom workflows for processing high volumes of images. Problem-solving and clear communication were essential to my success.

Additional Responsibilities:
• Effectively communicated new file requirements to the team and ensured the specs are met.
• Maintained a bird’s eye view of the overall shoot progress and brought attention to any potential issues before they arose. 
• Quickly distilled what was needed to satisfy the needs of multiple departments as well as art directors, creative directors, and the photographer.
• Found creative solutions and workarounds to achieve optimal results, but also communicated to the client when there was an issue that didn't have a suitable workaround.  
• Developed a custom system to process out large volumes of images during shoots in order to meet immediate turnarounds.
profile_positions.title: Owner • Digital Operator

volunteer_experiences.description: As a personal project, Chad and I photographed a story about Bonga Cycling Academy in South Africa. We wanted to help bring attention to the amazing social development and recreational activities they provide to children living in the townships. Bonga offers children a place to play and grow, establish values of accountability and responsibility, and set and achieve their goals. We were able to help shed light on this organization through getting the story featured in Good Sport Magazine and Athleta Magazine.
